previewText:
[Narrator] Coy gazes, stolen glances, secret smiles,
All by the moonlight’s soft embrace concealed;
Torn by desire, hope and fear beguiled,
Gathering courage, my heart longs to yield.
In shadows, rivals loom, those I must sway,
Remove, so none can stand between us two;
Love's game I'll play, I'll make them rue the day,
Vowing to win this heart that I pursue.
In shadows, I must wear a clever guise,
Lies spun like silk, a web to catch my prize;
Lament, my love, for truth's a fleeting wraith,
In the end, you'll see, deceit is love's true face.
And when I've bested all who dare compete,
Now, we shall join, our fates entwined complete.

0.text:
[Narrator] Coy gazes, stolen glances, secret smiles,
All by the moonlight’s soft embrace concealed;
Torn by desire, hope and fear beguiled,
Gathering courage, my heart longs to yield.
In shadows, rivals loom, those I must sway,
Remove, so none can stand between us two;
Love's game I'll play, I'll make them rue the day,
Vowing to win this heart that I pursue.
In shadows, I must wear a clever guise,
Lies spun like silk, a web to catch my prize;
Lament, my love, for truth's a fleeting wraith,
In the end, you'll see, deceit is love's true face.
And when I've bested all who dare compete,
Now, we shall join, our fates entwined complete.

1.text: [Narrator] Amidst the cacophony of New York's urban symphony, a petite damsel, hailing from the sun-kissed pastures of Italy, found herself christened as Reona, embarking upon her nascent sojourn at the hallowed halls of NYU. A mélange of trepidation and exhilaration imbued her very essence, as she stood diminutive yet defiant, upon the threshold of the looming edifice that was to be her dormitory - the ivory tower in which her dreams were to be woven and unraveled, like a tapestry of fate spun by the hands of the divine.

2.text: [Reona] *Mumbling* Okay, Reona, you've got this. New city, new friends, new life. Deep breath in, deep breath out.

3.text: [Narrator] As the timeworn door emitted a sonorous creak, akin to the sigh of an ancient oak, an enigmatic resident assistant, christened Wictor, emerged from the penumbral depths, his visage haloed by the chiaroscuro of the dimly lit chamber. His smoldering gaze - a tempestuous maelstrom of obsidian and coal - ensnared her heart within its ardent embrace, causing the delicate instrument to flutter and falter, skipping a beat like a graceful dancer losing her footing upon life's grand stage.

4.text: [Wictor] Ah, you must be Reona. Welcome to NYU! I'm Wictor, your resident assistant. Let me help you with your bags.

5.text: [Reona] Oh, um, thank you. Nice to meet you, Wictor.

6.text: [Narrator] In the midst of their congenial repartee, Reona's perceptive gaze, akin to an eagle soaring through the empyrean heights, espied a curious and enigmatic trinket suspended from Wictor's sinewy neck. The locket, veiled in the aura of a cryptic past, appeared to be a Pandora's box of shadows - wherein slumbered the most arcane of secrets, yearning to be unsheathed from the confines of its metallic prison, like a nocturnal moth fluttering toward the seductive allure of a flickering flame.

7.text: [Reona] That's a beautiful locket you have there. Is there a story behind it?

8.text: [Wictor] *Pauses, then smiles* Yes, but it's a story for another time. Today is about you and your new beginning.

9.text: [Narrator] Traversing the labyrinthine corridors, Reona's heart prances to a frenzied tempo, a rhapsody composed of the tantalizing allure of her newfound existence and the irresistible gravitation towards the enigmatic persona of Wictor. As they promenade through the hallowed passageways, the air between them crackles with an electric frisson, an ardent dance of unspoken desires and uncharted emotions, weaving an intricate web of secret passions, ensnaring both the ingénue and the sphinx-like figure that accompanies her.

10.text: [Wictor] So, Reona, what brings you to NYU?

11.text: [Reona] Well, I've always been interested in Japanese culture, and I heard NYU has an amazing program. Plus, I've always wanted to live in New York City.

12.text: [Wictor] You've made a great choice. Our Japanese department chair, Professor Diego, is the best in his field. And the city is full of opportunities.

13.text: [Narrator] As they reach Reona's dorm room, Wictor smoothly takes her luggage, opening the door with a flourish.

14.text: [Wictor] Welcome to your new home away from home, Reona.

15.text: [Reona] Thank you, Wictor. I appreciate your help.

16.text: [Narrator] As they enter, they are greeted by the sight of a cheerful Yumi, the embodiment of kawaii, sitting on her bed.

17.text: [Yumi] Hi, I'm Yumi! You must be Reona, my new roommate.

18.text: [Reona] Yes, that's me! It's nice to meet you, Yumi.

19.text: [Narrator] Almost immediately, Reona and Yumi bond over their shared love for sweets, books, and anime.

20.text: [Reona] I can't believe you like "Gakuen Handsome" too! It's in the top ten of my favorite animes.

21.text: [Yumi] Same here! We should definitely have a marathon once we're settled in.

22.text: [Reona] Who is your husbando? Mitsurugi? Kagami? I am a Saionji stan myself!

23.text: [Yumi] (nervous laugh) Oh, uhh, I don't really know much about husbando...

24.text: [Reona] (realizes something) Wait a minute... Yumi, are you not into boys or something? (giggles)

25.text: [Yumi] (blushes) Well, it's complicated. You could say that I'm gay... and nonbinary. Actually, I kind of identify as half Japanese and half cat.

26.text: [Narrator] Reona's eyes widen in surprise, but she remains accepting and open-minded. This is NYU afterall.

27.text: [Reona] That's so cool! I've never met anyone like you before, Yumi. Can we watch "Revolutionary Girl Utena" together later?

28.text: [Yumi] [smiles mischievously] Only if we get some ice cream to go with it!

29.text: [Narrator] As they begin to unpack Reona's belongings, Yumi stumbles upon an old, tattered love letter hidden behind the dresser.

30.text: [Yumi] Hey, Reona, look what I found!

32.text: [Narrator] Yumi carefully unfolds the fragile paper, revealing the faded ink of a beautifully written love letter.

33.text: [Yumi] It seems to be a love letter from the past. Listen to this:

35.text: [Yumi] In twilight's hush, as shadows creep,

36.text: [Yumi] From dreams I stirred, and scarce could sigh;

37.text: [Yumi] The moon shone full, the night was deep,

40.text: [Yumi] A zephyr whispered to a rose:

42.text: [Yumi] Of hearts that wake, while eyelids close.

44.text: [Yumi] The world lay hushed in silver beams,

45.text: [Yumi] Each petal cradled on a breeze;

47.text: [Yumi] The nightingale sang to the trees.

48.text: [Yumi] As quiet hours in slumber waned,

49.text: [Yumi] I heard a voice that called my name;

50.text: [Yumi] The voice of love, it sweetly pained —

51.text: [Yumi] My heart replied, with trembling flame.

53.text: [Reona] Wow, that's so romantic. Do you think they were star-crossed lovers, like Romeo and Juliet?

54.text: [Yumi] Maybe... or perhaps they overcame the odds and found happiness together.

55.text: [Narrator] The girls' curiosity is piqued, and they spend the afternoon discussing the possible story behind the letter, creating the foundation of a friendship that will define their college years. Little do they know that their own lives will soon become entwined with the secrets and passions of the past.

56.text: [Narrator] The excitement of orientation night fills the air as Reona and Yumi join the throng of students on campus.

57.text: [Reona] I can't believe we're finally here, Yumi! NYU, new friends, and a whole new adventure!

58.text: [Yumi] I know, right? I'm so glad we found each other, Reona. This is going to be amazing!

59.text: [Narrator] As they navigate through the crowd, Reona spots a familiar face, one she's only ever seen in pixels.

61.text: [Chen] Reona! It's finally nice to meet you in person!

62.text: [Narrator] They embrace, their online bond transcending into the real world.

63.text: [Yumi] So, you two have been friends for a while? That's awesome!

64.text: [Chen] Yeah, we've been mutuals for years. I couldn't pass up the chance to attend NYU with Reona.

65.text: [Narrator] The trio continues to explore the party, enjoying the music, food, drinks, and the company.

66.text: [Reona] (laughs) I never thought I'd see you dance, Chen! You're actually pretty good!

67.text: [Chen] (blushing) Well, I've been practicing just for this moment.

68.text: [Narrator] As the night wears on, Yumi overhears a tantalizing rumor from a group of students.

69.text: [Yumi] Hey, Reona, Chen! I just heard something really interesting. Apparently, our dorm is haunted!

70.text: [Reona] (intrigued) Really? By what kind of spirit?

71.text: [Yumi] They say it's a lovelorn ghost, tied to the building by the memory of a tragic romance.

72.text: [Reona] Well, we should definitely investigate. Who knows, maybe it's connected to that love letter we found!

73.text: [Narrator] United by curiosity, the three friends make a pact to uncover the truth behind the haunting.

74.text: [Reona] To new beginnings, new friendships, and unraveling the mysteries of NYU!

77.text: [Narrator] With laughter and determination, Reona, Yumi, and Chen toast to their adventures yet to come, unaware of the supernatural twists their lives are about to take.

78.text: [Narrator] As the city's lights flicker through their window, Reona drifts into a deep slumber.

80.text: [Narrator] She finds herself enveloped by a vivid dream, in which the rumored spirit reveals itself to her.

81.text: [Spirit] Greetings, young one. I am the spirit of this dormitory, bound here by a love that was never fulfilled.

82.text: [Reona] (awed) Wow... So the rumors were true! But why have you appeared to me?

83.text: [Spirit] I've sensed your kind and adventurous heart, and I have a message for you. You are destined to find love, but it will manifest in the most unexpected of forms.

84.text: [Reona] (blushing) Really? But who could it be?

85.text: [Spirit] That is for you to discover, my dear young one. But beware, a hidden enemy lurks in the shadows, plotting to sabotage your happiness.

86.text: [Reona] (frowning) An enemy? But I'm new here... who could it be?

87.text: [Spirit] The answers will reveal themselves in time. Trust your instincts and the bonds you forge with those around you.

88.text: [Narrator] With that, the spirit vanishes, and Reona jolts awake, her heart pounding.

89.text: [Reona] (whispering) That was so real... I need to tell Yumi and Chen about this!

90.text: [Narrator] As the first light of dawn creeps through the window, Reona lies awake, her thoughts racing with the implications of the spirit's message. Little does she know that her journey to unravel the mysteries of love and betrayal has only just begun.

91.text: [Reona] (yawning) Good morning, Yumi. What's for breakfast?

92.text: [Yumi] Ohayō, Reona-chan! I made us some fluffy pancakes and fresh fruit. I hope you like them!

93.text: [Reona] They look delicious, thanks! (pauses) Yumi, can I tell you something... kind of strange?

94.text: [Yumi] Of course, Reona-chan. You can tell me anything.

95.text: [Reona] Well, last night, I had this really vivid dream. There was this spirit who told me I'm destined to find love, but in an unexpected form. And there's a hidden enemy out there who wants to ruin my happiness.

96.text: [Yumi] (gasping) No way! I had a similar dream too! The spirit told me that we're connected somehow, and that we need to watch out for each other.

97.text: [Reona] That's so weird... Do you think it means something?

98.text: [Yumi] I don't know, but it's definitely not a coincidence.

99.text: [Narrator] Suddenly, a gust of wind blows through the open window, causing the curtains to flutter and the girls to shiver.

101.text: [Yumi] I-I don't know... Maybe it's just the wind... or maybe it's a sign that the spirit is watching over us.

103.text: [Narrator] They continue eating their breakfast in silence, their minds racing with thoughts of the mysterious spirit and the hidden enemy.

104.text: [Yumi] (breaking the silence) Reona-chan, let's promise each other that we'll always have each other's backs, no matter what.

105.text: [Reona] (smiling) I promise, Yumi. We'll face whatever comes our way together.

106.text: [Narrator] Yumi and Reona clasp their hands together, sealing their promise as they prepare to face the unknown challenges that await them at NYU.

107.text: [Narrator] As Reona, Yumi, and Chen enter the classroom for their Introduction to Japanese History course, they're captivated by their enigmatic professor, Diego.

108.text: [Reona] (whispers) This is it, our first class. I'm so excited!

109.text: [Yumi] (whispers) Me too! I've heard great things about this professor.

110.text: [Chen] (whispers) Just remember, we're all here together. We'll get through this.

111.text: [Diego] Good morning, students. Welcome to Introduction to Japanese History. I'm Professor Diego, and I'll be your guide through the rich tapestry of Japan's past.

113.text: [Yumi] (whispering back) I know, right? But there's something about him... something mysterious.

114.text: [Chen] (whispering to Reona) You really think so? I don't know, he seems kind of... ordinary to me.

115.text: [Narrator] As the lecture begins, Reona finds herself daydreaming about romantic encounters with Diego. In her mind's eye, they stroll through cherry blossom-filled gardens and share intimate candlelit dinners.

116.text: [Reona] (thinking) What am I doing? I just met him, and he's my professor. But there's something so alluring about him...

117.text: [Narrator] Yet, in the midst of her reverie, she can't shake the feeling that Diego's allure hides a darker secret.

118.text: [Diego] Today, we'll be discussing the Heian period, a time of great cultural and artistic achievement in Japan. The imperial court was at its height, and many fascinating stories emerged from this era.

119.text: [Reona] (thinks) There's something about him... I can't quite put my finger on it.

120.text: [Yumi] (whispers) Hey, are you okay? You seem a little... distracted.

121.text: [Reona] (whispers) Yeah, I'm fine. Just... lost in thought.

122.text: [Narrator] As the lecture continues, Reona observes Diego carefully, trying to undress the mysterious aura that surrounds him. But as Diego speaks, she notices his gaze occasionally lingering on her, sending shivers down her spine.

123.text: [Diego] In the Heian period, the imperial court was a hotbed of intrigue and romance. Passionate love affairs were whispered about behind closed doors, and secret alliances were formed in the shadows.

124.text: [Reona] (thinking) It's like he's speaking directly to me... like he knows what I'm feeling.

125.text: [Narrator] As the class comes to an end, Reona can't help but feel a magnetic pull towards Diego, her curiosity piqued by the enigmatic professor.

126.text: [Diego] That's all for today. Next time, we'll delve further into the Heian period, examining the role of women in the imperial court.

127.text: [Narrator] As the class ends, Diego approaches Reona, his magnetic presence drawing her in like a moth to a flame.

128.text: [Diego] Miss Reona, a word, if you don't mind?

130.text: [Diego] I couldn't help but notice that you seemed somewhat... preoccupied during today's lecture. Is there something on your mind?

131.text: [Reona] (hesitating) It's just... I've been having these strange dreams lately. And I can't help but feel like they're connected to... you, somehow.

132.text: [Diego] (smiling enigmatically) Dreams can often be a window into our subconscious desires, Miss Reona. Perhaps there's a part of you that's yearning for something... forbidden.

133.text: [Narrator] As Reona gazes into Diego's eyes, she feels a confusing mixture of attraction and apprehension. The spirit's warning echoes in her mind, and she wonders what hidden enemy could be lurking in the shadows, plotting to sabotage her happiness.

134.text: [Narrator] With the echoes of her professor's enigmatic voice still lingering on her mind, Reona lead Yumi and Chen to the bustling campus cafeteria, seeking sustenance and a chance to discuss the mysterious dreams that have plagued her night.

135.text: [Reona] I can't believe we both had the same dream. What do you think it means?

136.text: [Yumi] I don't know, but it can't just be a coincidence, right?

137.text: [Chen] Maybe it's a sign that you two are destined to be best friends. You know, like a spiritual connection or something.

138.text: [Reona] (nervously) Or maybe it's something more supernatural, like the spirit trying to communicate with us.

139.text: [Yumi] (excited) Oh, that would be so cool! Like a ghostly guardian angel!

140.text: [Chen] (skeptical) I don't know about that. It could just be a shared subconscious thing, like when people have dreams about falling.

141.text: [Reona] But why would we both dream about the same spirit with the same message?

142.text: [Yumi] (whispering) And what about the hidden enemy it warned us about?

143.text: [Chen] (shaking his head) I think you're reading too much into this. Dreams can be weird, but they're not always prophecies.

144.text: [Reona] (thoughtful) Maybe you're right, but I can't help feeling like there's something more to it.

145.text: [Yumi] (nodding) Me too. We should keep our eyes open for anything unusual.

146.text: [Narrator] As the trio continues to dissect their shared dreams, their voices meld with the cacophony of laughter and chatter that fills the bustling cafeteria. Unbeknownst to them, a mysterious figure watches from afar, their face concealed by a hooded cloak. The figure's eyes narrow as they observe the animated conversation, a sense of foreboding hanging heavily in the air.

147.text: [Chen] (unaware) So, let's say there is a supernatural connection. What do we do about it?

148.text: [Reona] (hesitant) I guess we could try to find out more about the spirit, like who she was and why she's haunting our dorm.

149.text: [Yumi] (determined) And we should look out for each other, just in case that hidden enemy is real.

150.text: [Chen] (sighs) Fine, but we'll need to be careful not to let our imaginations run wild. There's a fine line between being vigilant and becoming paranoid.

151.text: [Reona] (smiling) Agreed. We'll keep our feet on the ground and our eyes open for anything out of the ordinary.

152.text: [Narrator] With a renewed sense of camaraderie and purpose, the trio delves deeper into their spirited discussion, unaware of the enigmatic figure whose gaze remains fixed upon them. As the sun begins its slow descent, casting long shadows across the campus, an air of mystery and danger swirls around them, hinting at the thrilling adventures that lie ahead.

153.text: [Narrator] As the day draws to a close, Reona returns to the dorm, her mind racing with unanswered questions. She encounters Wictor in the hallway and, unable to contain her curiosity, she asks him about the chilling rumors surrounding the dorm.

154.text: [Reona] Wictor, do you know anything about the rumors that our dorm is haunted?

155.text: [Wictor] (sighs) Yes, Reona, I'm afraid it's true. Several years ago, a few students went missing without a trace. It's said that their spirits still linger here, searching for closure.

156.text: [Reona] That's so frightening… Have you ever experienced anything supernatural here?

157.text: [Wictor] To be honest, I have had a few encounters that I can't quite explain. But I've always tried to keep a level head and not let it affect my duties as a resident assistant.

158.text: [Reona] It must be difficult to carry that burden.

159.text: [Wictor] It is, but life goes on, and I try to focus on helping students like you adjust to their new lives here.

160.text: [Reona] I appreciate that, Wictor. By the way, I couldn't help but notice again the locket you're wearing. It's quite unique. Does it have any significance?

161.text: [Wictor] (rubbing the locket) This? It belonged to someone very dear to me. It's a constant reminder of the love we shared and the promises we made to each other. But that's a story for another time.

162.text: [Reona] I understand. I'm sorry if I was being too nosy.

163.text: [Wictor] No need to apologize, Reona. You're just curious, and that's a good thing. Just remember to stay vigilant, and if you ever need someone to talk to, I'm here for you.

164.text: [Reona] Thank you, Wictor. I'll keep that in mind.

165.text: [Narrator] As Wictor departs, the locket catches Reona's eye once more, piquing her curiosity. The enigmas surrounding the dormitory appear to be increasingly complex and ominous, but Reona resolves to unravel the truth and safeguard her newfound friends from the concealed dangers that await.

166.text: [Narrator] Exhausted from the day's events, Reona falls into a fitful slumber before Yumi returns. In her dream, a spectral figure materializes, shrouded in shadows.

167.text: [Spirit] Beware, young one. Trust only yourself and no one else.

168.text: [Reona] Who... who are you? What do you want from me?

169.text: [Spirit] I am here to guide you, but you must remain vigilant. There are forces beyond your understanding at play.

170.text: [Reona] But, how can I trust you?

171.text: [Spirit] You will know soon enough. Remember, trust only yourself.

172.text: [Narrator] As the spirit fades away, Reona awakens in a cold sweat, her heart pounding. She hears the door creak open, and Yumi returns, but there's something different about her eyes - a sinister glint that wasn't there before.

174.text: [Yumi] Of course, it's me, silly. Why do you ask?

175.text: [Reona] I... I just had a strange dream. A spirit warned me to trust only myself.

176.text: [Yumi] Spirits? Dreams? You're just tired, Reona. It's been a long day.

177.text: [Reona] You're right, but... there's something different about you, Yumi. I can't quite put my finger on it.

178.text: [Yumi] Different? Me? (laughs) You must be seeing things. I'm the same old Yumi, I promise.

179.text: [Reona] Maybe you're right. I guess I'm just a little paranoid after everything that's happened.

180.text: [Yumi] Don't worry about it, Reona. We'll face whatever comes our way together.

181.text: [Reona] (smiles) Thanks, Yumi. That means a lot.

182.text: [Narrator] As Reona tries to shake off the lingering unease, she wonders if the spirit's warning was merely a figment of her imagination or a harbinger of danger to come. Only time will tell, as the shadows of NYU's mysteries continue to deepen.

183.text: [Narrator] Reona awakens to find the sun streaming through the curtains, casting a golden glow on the room.

184.text: [Reona] (yawning) Good morning, Yumi. You're up early today.

185.text: [Yumi] (cheerfully) Good morning, Reona! I just couldn't sleep anymore, so I thought I'd tidy up our room a bit!

186.text: [Reona] That's nice of you, Yumi. Hey, I wanted to talk to you about something.

188.text: [Reona] So, yesterday, I talked to Wictor about the rumors surrounding our dorm, and he confirmed that some students vanished years ago.

189.text: [Yumi] (gasps) That's so creepy! What else did he say?

190.text: [Reona] He didn't know much more, but it definitely makes me think that we should look into it.

191.text: [Yumi] I agree. I mean, we both had those strange dreams, and now this? It's too much of a coincidence.

192.text: [Reona] Exactly. So, how about we make a pact to solve this mystery together?

193.text: [Yumi] (excitedly) Yes! I'm in! Let's do it, Reona!

194.text: [Reona] Great! Now that we're a team, we need to figure out where to start.

195.text: [Yumi] Hmm... maybe we should take another look at that old love letter we found. It could be connected, right?

196.text: [Reona] That's a good idea, Yumi. Let's see if we can find any clues in the letter.

197.text: [Narrator] Reona retrieves the tattered love letter from her desk drawer, and the two friends carefully unfold it, searching for any hidden messages.

200.text: [Yumi] Our hearts like magnets drew us near;

201.text: [Yumi] Love's rhymes entwined, our fates immersed,

202.text: [Yumi] Two souls adrift in passion's sphere.

203.text: [Yumi] We spoke of trust, of constancy,

204.text: [Yumi] Of passion's fire, that knows no end;

205.text: [Yumi] Each phrase a vow, of loyalty,

206.text: [Yumi] Our love, a fortress to defend.

209.text: [Yumi] Of two hearts, twined in music's art;

210.text: [Yumi] In Love's sweet notes, the songbird sings,

211.text: [Yumi] A melody to bind and part.

212.text: [Yumi] But time would change our symphony,

213.text: [Yumi] As cruel fate played its refrain;

214.text: [Yumi] A storm of jealousy and envy,

215.text: [Yumi] Would sweep across our love's domain.

217.text: [Yumi] It's so tragic... I wonder what happened to them.

218.text: [Reona] I don't know, but the way the letter is written, it seems like they were hiding their love from someone.

219.text: [Yumi] Maybe their love was the reason they disappeared? Like, someone found out and did something terrible?

220.text: [Reona] It's possible. We should try to find out more about these two people and see if it leads us anywhere.

221.text: [Yumi] Right. Let's start by asking around campus. Maybe someone knows something about this old love story.

222.text: [Reona] Good plan, Yumi. We'll solve this mystery and uncover the truth, no matter what it takes.

223.text: [Narrator] With their newfound determination, Reona and Yumi set out on their quest to unravel the secrets of the haunted dormitory and the tragic love story hidden within its walls.

224.text: [Narrator] After a day of classes filled with whispered gossip and furtive glances, Reona and Yumi reunite to research the enigmatic disappearances.

225.text: [Reona] I can't believe how many articles and forum posts there are about the missing students.

226.text: [Yumi] Yeah, it's crazy! But look, I found something interesting. They all belonged to the same exclusive club.

227.text: [Reona] Really? What was the club called?

228.text: [Yumi] It doesn't say, but it mentions that they met in the basement of our dormitory.

229.text: [Reona] (shudder) That's creepy. Do you think there's a connection between the club and the disappearances?

230.text: [Yumi] It's hard to say, but it's definitely a lead worth looking into.

231.text: [Reona] Huh, that's strange. Why does the club itself seem so familiar to me?

232.text: [Yumi] Maybe it's because of the love letter we found. Remember how it was about a tragic love story? Maybe there's a connection between the club and the letter.

233.text: [Reona] That's a good point, Yumi. Maybe we should take another look at the letter and see if there's any mention of the club or its members.

235.text: [Yumi] What bitter torment love can bear,

236.text: [Yumi] When trust is shaken to its core;

237.text: [Yumi] The seeds of doubt, once sown, impair

238.text: [Yumi] The bond that once was strong before.

240.text: [Yumi] The serpent's hiss, a whispered lie;

242.text: [Yumi] Would pierce our hearts, and make love die.

245.text: [Yumi] That dreams of bliss should turn to tears;

246.text: [Yumi] The stars that shone so bright above,

247.text: [Yumi] Would lose their light in darker spheres.

248.text: [Yumi] Let not a tender heart be swayed,

249.text: [Yumi] By whispers sown in treacherous guise;

250.text: [Yumi] For once love's trust is breached, displayed,

251.text: [Yumi] The spark within our hearts soon dies.

253.text: [Yumi] Hey, maybe if we find out more about the club, we can figure out what happened to those students and put an end to these spooky rumors once and for all!

254.text: [Reona] I hope so, Yumi. The thought of our dorm being haunted is giving me chills.

255.text: [Narrator] With determination in their hearts, Reona and Yumi delve deeper into the enigmatic club, hoping to uncover the truth behind the chilling disappearances and the haunting presence that lurks within their dormitory. Little do they know, the truth may be far more sinister than they could ever imagine.

256.text: [Narrator] As twilight descends, Chen, his eyes shimmering with curiosity, invites Reona to dinner.

257.text: [Chen] Hey Reona, would you like to grab dinner with me tonight? I heard there's a great cafe just off campus.

258.text: [Reona] Oh, sure! I'd love to. I haven't really explored much of New York yet.

259.text: [Narrator] As they dine under the stars, their conversation turns to the unsolved mystery and the murmurs that haunt the campus.

260.text: [Reona] You know, I've been hearing all these crazy stories about our dorm being haunted. Do you really believe in that stuff?

261.text: [Chen] I think it's just superstition, but I can see why people might find it interesting.

262.text: [Reona] You're probably right, but something about it feels... off. Like there's more to it than just rumors.

263.text: [Chen] Hmm, I guess we'll just have to see how things unfold.

264.text: [Chen] There's something I've been meaning to tell you. My older brother vanished under similar circumstances years ago.

265.text: [Reona] Really? That's so... I'm so sorry, Chen. I had no idea.

266.text: [Chen] It's okay. It happened a long time ago, and I've learned to live with it. But I can't help but feel a connection to the rumors surrounding the dorm.

267.text: [Reona] I can understand why you'd feel that way. Maybe we can look into it together?

268.text: [Chen] Yeah, maybe. I just hope we don't end up getting in over our heads.

269.text: [Narrator] As the night unfolds, Reona and Chen exchange stories, laughter, and confidences under the canopy of stars. Despite their diverging beliefs, they find solace in their shared quest for truth.

270.text: [Narrator] As the evening draws to a close, Reona's heart swells with anticipation for the mysteries that lie ahead, and she invites Chen back to her room. Upon their arrival, Yumi's eyes flash with jealousy, and a palpable tension fills the air.

272.text: [Reona] I invited Chen over. We were talking about the mystery and...

273.text: [Yumi] (interrupting) No. This is a girls and cats only domain. Boys are not allowed.

274.text: [Chen] Reona invited me. We were just...

275.text: [Yumi] (cutting him off) I don't care. You are not a resident of this dorm. You need to leave.

276.text: [Reona] (defensively) Yumi, it's not a big deal. We're just hanging out.

277.text: [Narrator] Yumi's eyes narrow as she stares Chen down. Reluctantly, Chen leaves the room.

278.text: [Reona] Yumi, that was rude! Chen is my friend, too.

279.text: [Yumi] (fuming) This is our space, Reona. You need to let me know before you invite anyone over.

280.text: [Reona] We're all working on this mystery together, and...

281.text: [Yumi] (interrupting) Working together with him? It's our mystery, we found it!

282.text: [Narrator] As Reona and Yumi exchange heated words, they realize that their shared quest to uncover the truth may demand a price they're not prepared to pay.

283.text: [Reona] This isn't just about us, Yumi. We need to find out what happened to those students!

284.text: [Yumi] (softening) I know. I just... I thought... I don't... want anyone else...

285.text: [Reona] Shh... We need to work together, okay?

286.text: [Narrator] Yumi nods, her anger dissipated. A sudden knock on the door interrupts their reconciliation.

288.text: [Reona] I don't know. Maybe Chen forgot something?

289.text: [Narrator] Reona opens the door to find no one there. The hallway is eerily empty, and an ominous feeling settles over the girls.

290.text: [Yumi] (nervously) Maybe it was just a prank?

291.text: [Reona] (whispering) Or maybe it's a sign that we're getting too close to the truth.

292.text: [Narrator] The girls exchange a glance, their newfound unity reignited by the mysterious knock. Together, they prepare to face the unknown.

293.text: [Narrator] Reona awakens to the mysterious presence of an ancient Japanese manuscript outside her door. She picks it up, feeling both curiosity and unease.

294.text: [Reona] Yumi, look what I found outside our door. It's an old Japanese manuscript. I wonder who left it here.

295.text: [Yumi] That's so strange. It's beautiful, though. Let's take a closer look.

296.text: [Narrator] As Reona presents the enigmatic tome to Yumi, she accidentally gets a papercut, drawing blood from her finger.

298.text: [Yumi] Oh no, Reona! Let me help you.

299.text: [Narrator] In a moment of passionate empathy, Yumi tenderly sucks on Reona's finger, stopping the bleeding while leaving Reona blushing at the intimate gesture.

301.text: [Yumi] No problem, Reona. I'm just glad I could help.

302.text: [Narrator] Just then, Reona senses a dark aura that seems to emanate from the manuscript itself, hinting at a dark secret it holds.

303.text: [Reona] Yumi, I don't know how to explain it, but I feel like there's something dark and powerful within this manuscript.

304.text: [Yumi] You're probably just imagining things, Reona. Maybe we should show it to Professor Diego. He might know something about it.

305.text: [Reona] You're right. Let's take it to him later today.

306.text: [Narrator] As they get ready for class, the enigmatic manuscript lingers in their minds, hinting at the hidden mysteries and perilous journey that awaits them.

307.text: [Narrator] Intrigued and seeking answers, Reona and Yumi approach the enigmatic Professor Diego during his office hours, clutching the ancient Japanese manuscript.

308.text: [Reona] Professor Diego, we found this mysterious manuscript outside our door. Can you tell us anything about it?

309.text: [Diego] Ah, let me take a look. (Scans the first few pages) This is quite an interesting find. I believe it may be a work of fiction, but there's an otherworldly aura surrounding it.

310.text: [Yumi] What do you mean by "otherworldly aura," Professor?

311.text: [Diego] It's difficult to explain, my dear. Some texts, particularly those steeped in mysticism or folklore, have a certain energy about them. This manuscript seems to have a similar quality.

312.text: [Reona] Do you think it's connected to the rumors about our dormitory and the missing students?

313.text: [Diego] I am afraid I am not familiar with the rumors. But, I must admit I'm intrigued. May I keep the manuscript for two days? I promise to unveil its secrets and return it to you promptly.

314.text: [Yumi] Of course, Professor. We'd be grateful for any information you can provide.

315.text: [Diego] Excellent. I'll get to work immediately.

316.text: [Narrator] As Reona and Yumi prepare to leave, Reona notices the same dark aura lurking in the corner of Diego's office.

317.text: [Reona] (Whispers to Yumi) Yumi, do you see that? The dark aura... it's here in the professor's office.

319.text: [Reona] I'm positive. It's the same dark presence I felt when we found the manuscript.

320.text: [Yumi] Maybe we should tell Professor Diego about it.

321.text: [Reona] No, not yet. Let's see what he finds out about the manuscript first. We don't want to jump to conclusions.

322.text: [Yumi] You're right. We'll wait for his findings and keep an eye out for anything strange.

323.text: [Narrator] With a mixture of curiosity and trepidation, Reona and Yumi leave Professor Diego's office, wondering what secrets the ancient manuscript holds and how it connects to the haunting mysteries that surround their dormitory.

324.text: [Narrator] Seeking to apologize to Chen, Reona invites him out to lunch.

325.text: [Reona] Chen, I am sorry about last night. But this morning, something strange appeared. Have you ever heard of a manuscript that could have a dark aura?

326.text: [Chen] Hmm, not really. But it sounds like something straight out of an anime! Like, maybe it has some hidden power, or it's cursed.

327.text: [Reona] (laughs) You're such an otaku. But I have to admit, it's kind of exciting.

328.text: [Chen] So, what else have you been up to, aside from investigating haunted dorms and mysterious manuscripts?

329.text: [Reona] Oh, you know, just the usual college stuff. Classes, homework, daydreaming about enigmatic professors...

330.text: [Chen] (blushing) Daydreaming, huh? Sounds like someone's got a crush.

331.text: [Reona] What?! No, it's not like that! I just... admire him, that's all. (blushing) Anyway, what about you? How are your classes going?

332.text: [Chen] They're okay, I guess. But I'd rather be gaming or watching anime. Speaking of which, have you seen the latest episode of "Higurashi no Naku Koro ni"?

333.text: [Reona] (excited) Yes! I can't believe they made another season, and this episode left us on such a cliffhanger!

334.text: [Narrator] As they learn more about each other, Reona finds herself drawn to Chen's endearing shyness.

335.text: [Chen] (nervous) Um, I know this might be a bit forward, but I wanted to give you something.

336.text: [Narrator] As they part ways, Chen hands Reona a delicate red spider lily, symbolizing the blossoming connection between them.

337.text: [Reona] (touched) Chen, this is beautiful. Thank you.

338.text: [Chen] (blushing) It's nothing, really. I just thought it would look nice with your hair.

339.text: [Reona] (smiling) You're really sweet, you know that?

340.text: [Chen] (stammering) Uh, thanks. I, uh, try my best.

341.text: [Narrator] Just as Chen turns to leave, Reona catches a glimpse of a mysterious tattoo on his wrist, seeming to spell out DLC.

342.text: [Reona] Wait, Chen! What's that tattoo on your wrist?

343.text: [Chen] (startled) Oh, this? It's, um, just something my brother and I got when we were younger. It's, uh, not important.

344.text: [Reona] Are you sure? It looks kind of... interesting.

345.text: [Chen] (nervous) Really, it's nothing. I should get going. I'll see you later, okay?

346.text: [Reona] (curious) Alright, if you say so. Take care, Chen.

347.text: [Narrator] As Chen hurries away, Reona can't help but feel that there's more to the story behind the enigmatic tattoo. Little did she know, the mysteries surrounding her were only just beginning to unravel.

348.text: [Narrator] As if guided by an unseen force, Reona crosses paths with Wictor in the dorm hallway.

349.text: [Wictor] The manuscript you discovered must have originated from someone here. After all, no one outside should have access to our dorm.

350.text: [Reona] I thought so too, but why would someone leave it outside my door?

351.text: [Wictor] Who knows? Maybe they saw your interest in the supernatural and thought you'd be intrigued.

352.text: [Narrator] His piercing gaze lingers on Reona, and she feels a chill down her spine.

353.text: [Reona] (nervously) I guess... Hey, have you noticed anything strange about Professor Diego? I saw a dark aura in his office earlier...

354.text: [Wictor] Diego has always been a bit... mysterious. But that's what makes him so alluring, isn't it?

355.text: [Narrator] As he walks away, Reona notices a similar aura following Wictor, the same as the one in Diego's office.

356.text: [Reona] (whispering to herself) What is going on here?

357.text: [Narrator] Suddenly, she realizes that the manuscript may be more than just a work of fiction, and that the lives of those around her are entwined in this unfolding mystery.

358.text: [Reona] This isn't just some old story... It's connected to everyone here.

359.text: [Narrator] With an uneasy feeling, Reona rushes back to her room, determined to uncover the truth behind the manuscript and the dark auras surrounding her newfound friends. Little does she know, the answers she seeks may come at a great cost.

360.text: [Narrator] The morning sun casts a golden glow on the dormitory, signaling a day of leisure and relaxation for everyone.

361.text: [Reona] It's such a lovely day! A picnic will be the perfect way to unwind from all the strange things that have been happening lately.

362.text: [Yumi] I agree, Reona-chan! I can't wait to spend some quality time with all of you. *giggles*

363.text: [Chen] Yeah, let's all hang out and have some fun. I'm really looking forward to it.

364.text: [Wictor] I must admit, the idea of a picnic is quite...quaint. But I suppose it could be enjoyable.

365.text: [Reona] Oh, come on, Wictor! It'll be a fun and relaxing day for all of us.

366.text: [Wictor] *sighs* Very well. I'll participate in your little outing.

367.text: [Yumi] Yay! I'll prepare some sandwiches and sweets for us to enjoy!

368.text: [Chen] I'll bring some drinks and snacks.

369.text: [Reona] Great! And I'll pack a blanket and some utensils. Wictor, do you want to contribute something?

370.text: [Wictor] I suppose I could provide some entertainment.

372.text: [Narrator] As they gather their belongings, Reona can't help but feel the weight of the mysterious manuscript's secrets bearing down on her.

373.text: [Reona] *whispers to Yumi* I can't shake the feeling that something isn't right. The manuscript, the aura, and now the connection to Wictor...

374.text: [Yumi] *whispers back* I know, but we can't let it ruin our day. We need to stay focused and enjoy ourselves. We'll deal with the mystery later, okay?

375.text: [Reona] *nods* You're right. It's just hard to ignore.

376.text: [Chen] Hey, are you two ready? We should head out soon.

378.text: [Narrator] With their belongings in hand, the group sets off for their picnic, attempting to put aside the mysteries that have plagued them in recent days. Little do they know, the day's events will only serve to deepen the enigma surrounding them.

379.text: [Narrator] At the park, the group enjoys a delightful feast of sandwiches, fruits, and laughter. The sun shines brightly, and the air is filled with the scent of blooming flowers.

380.text: [Yumi] This is so much fun! We should do this more often.

381.text: [Reona] Yeah, it's nice to just relax and not worry about anything.

382.text: [Chen] I have to say, Yumi, your sandwiches are amazing.

383.text: [Yumi] Thank you! I have a knack for making delicious things, if I do say so myself.

384.text: [Yumi] Okay, I have an idea! Let's play a parlour game. It'll be fun!

385.text: [Reona] Sounds great! What do you have in mind?

386.text: [Yumi] How about "Two Truths and a Lie"? We each say three things about ourselves, and the others have to guess which one is the lie.

387.text: [Chen] I'm in! That sounds like a fun way to learn more about each other.

389.text: [Narrator] As they play, Reona notices that the mysterious aura seems to have vanished, replaced by the warmth of camaraderie and shared experiences.

390.text: [Reona] (thinking) It's strange. I don't feel that dark presence anymore. It's as if being around my friends has chased it away.

391.text: [Chen] Alright, Reona, it's your turn. Tell us your two truths and a lie.

392.text: [Reona] Okay, let's see... I've never eaten a whole pizza by myself, I've never broken a bone, and I've never kissed anyone.

393.text: [Yumi] Ooh, I think the lie is that you've never kissed anyone.

394.text: [Wictor] I'm going to guess that the lie is that you've never broken a bone. You did mention being clumsy.

395.text: [Chen] I agree with Wictor. I think you've probably broken a bone before.

396.text: [Reona] Yumi got it right! The lie is that I've never kissed anyone. I am actually a great kisser. (winks)

397.text: [Narrator] As the game continues, laughter and joy fill the air. The dark mysteries of the past temporarily forgotten, the group of friends embrace the light of the present moment, unaware of the shadows that still lurk just beyond their reach.

398.text: [Narrator] As the afternoon progresses, the group takes a leisurely stroll around the park, discovering a charming little gazebo nestled among the trees.

399.text: [Reona] Wow, this gazebo is so beautiful! Let's take a break here.

400.text: [Yumi] I agree! It's so peaceful and serene. It's like a hidden sanctuary.

401.text: [Chen] Yeah, it's a perfect spot to relax and share stories.

402.text: [Wictor] Alright then, who wants to go first?

403.text: [Reona] I'll start. Back in my hometown, there was this old tree where I used to spend hours reading and dreaming of adventures in far-off places. Coming to NYU has been like stepping into one of those stories.

404.text: [Yumi] That's so sweet, Reona! I've always loved reading too. When I was little, I used to pretend I was a magical cat, helping magical girls save the world one adventure at a time.

405.text: [Chen] You know, my dream has always been to create a video game that brings people together from all over the world. I hope that by studying here, I can make that dream a reality.

406.text: [Wictor] As for me, I've always been fascinated by technology. It's what led me to become a computer scientist, and it's been an incredible journey so far.

407.text: [Reona] I never knew that about you, Wictor! It's amazing how we all have such different passions and dreams.

408.text: [Yumi] Yeah, it's like fate brought us together here at NYU to share our stories and grow together.

409.text: [Chen] It's true. I never thought I'd make such great friends in such a short amount of time.

410.text: [Wictor] Neither did I. It's been a pleasure getting to know all of you.

411.text: [Narrator] As the sun begins to set, the group reluctantly leaves the gazebo, their hearts filled with the warmth of newfound friendships. Little do they know that their bonds will be tested as they unravel the mysterious secrets of their dormitory.

412.text: [Narrator] The group gathers around a fire pit to toast marshmallows and make s'mores, the evening sky casting a warm, orange glow on their faces.

413.text: [Reona] I haven't made s'mores in ages! This brings back so many memories from my childhood.

414.text: [Yumi] Me too! It's such a cozy and comforting treat. Perfect for an evening like this.

415.text: [Chen] I've actually never had s'mores before. What's the best way to toast the marshmallows?

416.text: [Wictor] Ah, the eternal debate. Some like them lightly toasted, others prefer them burnt to a crisp. It's all about personal preference.

417.text: [Reona] I like mine golden brown, just a little bit crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside.

418.text: [Yumi] I'm with Reona on this one. That's the perfect marshmallow texture.

419.text: [Chen] Alright, I'll give it a try. Here goes nothing!

420.text: [Narrator] As the group toasts their marshmallows, laughter and lighthearted banter fill the air, blending with the crackling of the fire.

421.text: [Wictor] So, Reona, what were your favorite childhood memories involving s'mores?

422.text: [Reona] Oh, my father is a huge Americanophile and we used to have campfires in our backyard all the time. We'd roast marshmallows and tell stories late into the night.

423.text: [Chen] That sounds really nice. My family never did anything like that. It must have been a lot of fun.

424.text: [Yumi] I remember going camping with my family and making s'mores over a campfire. Those were some of my favorite moments growing up.

425.text: [Narrator] As they continue reminiscing, Reona can't help but notice that the mysterious dark aura seems to have returned, lurking just beyond the fire's light.

426.text: [Reona] (whispering to herself) Is it just my imagination?

427.text: [Wictor] What's wrong, Reona? You look a little uneasy.

428.text: [Reona] Oh, it's nothing. I just thought I saw something... odd. It's probably just my eyes playing tricks on me.

429.text: [Yumi] Are you sure? If something's bothering you, you can talk to us about it.

430.text: [Reona] I appreciate that, but I'm sure it's nothing. Let's just enjoy our s'mores and the fire.

431.text: [Narrator] As the flames flicker and dance, Reona shudders, unsure if the feeling is a result of the manuscript's influence or her own paranoia. With a hint of fear in her heart, she wonders what the night may hold for her and her newfound friends.

432.text: [Narrator] As the day draws to a close, back in the comfort of their dorm room, Reona and Yumi snuggle under a cozy blanket, bowls of ice cream in hand.

433.text: [Reona] This is exactly what I needed after such an intense week. I'm so glad we can just relax and enjoy some quality time together.

434.text: [Yumi] Me too, Reona-chan! There's nothing better than sharing a good anime with a great friend. Which series do you want to start with?

435.text: [Reona] Hmm, how about "Puella Magi Madoka Magica"? I've always loved the magical girl genre, and the art is fantastic.

436.text: [Yumi] That's one of my favorites too! Let's do it. I'll make the popcorn.

438.text: [Narrator] As the opening theme of "Puella Magi Madoka Magica" fills the room, Reona and Yumi become engrossed in the adventures of their favorite magical girls. They laugh together at the comedic moments and gasp in unison during the thrilling battles.

439.text: [Reona] I've always admired the strength and determination of the main character, Homura. She's such an inspiration.

440.text: [Yumi] I agree! She never gives up, no matter the odds. I wish I could be as fearless as her.

441.text: [Reona] You're pretty fearless yourself, Yumi. I mean, we're investigating a haunted dormitory and a mysterious manuscript together. That takes courage.

442.text: [Yumi] Haha, you're right! We're like magical girls ourselves, uncovering the truth and battling the darkness.

443.text: [Narrator] As the night wears on, Reona and Yumi share their thoughts on the characters and plot twists, occasionally pausing to grab more snacks or refill their ice cream bowls. The hours pass quickly, and soon their eyes grow heavy with exhaustion.

444.text: [Reona] (yawning) I think it's time for bed. I can barely keep my eyes open.

445.text: [Yumi] Me too. Sweet dreams, Reona-chan. Let's hope we don't have any more weird dreams tonight.

447.text: [Narrator] As Reona drifts off to sleep, she feels a sense of contentment and belonging that she hadn't experienced before. The mysterious shadows and the enigmatic manuscript are momentarily forgotten, replaced by the warmth of friendship.

448.text: [Narrator] A new day begins! Reona and Yumi knock on the door of Professor Diego's dimly-lit office. As they enter, they find him absorbed in the ancient manuscript, its pages yellowed and brittle with age.

449.text: [Reona] Professor, have you found anything about the manuscript?

450.text: [Diego] Ah, Reona and Yumi, perfect timing. This manuscript is a rare and powerful novel about occult magic, reminiscent of the works by the enigmatic Kyusaku Yumeno.

451.text: [Yumi] Wow, that's incredible! So, what does it say?

452.text: [Diego] I've spent the last few days painstakingly digitizing and translating the manuscript, with the help of an AI. Its knowledge is now preserved for future generations. Here, I'll send a translated copy to both of you.

453.text: [Reona] Thank you, Professor. We really appreciate your help.

454.text: [Diego] Be cautious with this newfound knowledge, girls. Delving into the realm of the occult can have unforeseen consequences.

456.text: [Reona] Yeah, we just want to understand the mysterious aura surrounding it and how it's connected to the dormitory.

457.text: [Diego] Just remember, knowledge is power, but it can also be a double-edged sword. Use it wisely and don't let it consume you.

458.text: [Yumi] Understood, Professor. We'll keep that in mind.

459.text: [Reona] Is there anything else we know about the manuscript or its author?

460.text: [Diego] Not much is known about the author, but the manuscript's powers seem to intertwine with its reader's fate. What you find within its pages may surprise you.

461.text: [Reona] That's... intriguing. We'll be sure to read it carefully.

462.text: [Yumi] Thank you for everything, Professor Diego.

463.text: [Diego] You're welcome, girls. Good luck on your quest for answers.

464.text: [Narrator] As Reona and Yumi leave the office, an air of mystery and anticipation surrounds them. Little do they know that the knowledge they now possess will lead them down a path of unexpected twists and hidden dangers.

465.text: [Narrator] Intrigued, Reona and Yumi return to their dorm and begin reading the mysterious manuscript in the common room, the air thick with anticipation.

466.text: [Reona] Can you believe we have a copy of such a rare and powerful manuscript? I can't wait to see what secrets it holds.

467.text: [Yumi] Me neither! Let's dive in and see what we can learn.

468.text: [Narrator] As they delve deeper into its arcane lore, Wictor enters the common room, a curious expression on his face.

469.text: [Wictor] Hey, what are you two up to? Did you get the manuscript back?

470.text: [Reona] We have. Professor Diego even translated it for us. It's a novel about occult magic, and we just can't put it down.

471.text: [Yumi] It's so fascinating, Wictor! You should read it too.

472.text: [Narrator] Reona, eager to share the excitement, sends him the manuscript.

473.text: [Wictor] Thanks, Reona. I'll definitely check it out.

474.text: [Reona] Chen might be interested in this too. I'll send him a copy.

476.text: [Narrator] As they continue to read, their eyes glued to the pages, a dark force begins to stir in the shadows.

477.text: [Wictor] Hey, did you guys feel that? A sudden chill just passed through the room.

478.text: [Reona] Yeah, I felt it too. It's like the temperature suddenly dropped.

479.text: [Yumi] (whispers) Do you think it has something to do with the manuscript?

480.text: [Reona] (whispers back) I don't know, but it's certainly strange.

481.text: [Narrator] Despite the unsettling atmosphere, the trio continues to read, entranced by the mysterious power of the manuscript.

482.text: [Wictor] The more I read, the more I feel like we're unlocking some hidden knowledge. It's a thrilling experience.

483.text: [Reona] I agree. I can't help but wonder what this knowledge might lead us to discover.

484.text: [Yumi] Just be careful, Reona. Remember Professor Diego's warning. We need to be cautious with this newfound knowledge.

485.text: [Narrator] As the night deepens, the dark force in the shadows grows stronger, feeding off the energy of the manuscript's readers. Unaware of the danger looming over them, Reona and her friends continue to explore the ancient manuscript, unknowingly inviting the darkness into their lives.

486.text: [Narrator] Late at night, Reona tosses and turns, unable to fall asleep due to the strange energy coursing through her. She decides to take a walk to clear her mind.

487.text: [Reona] I just need some fresh air. I'll be back soon, Yumi.

488.text: [Narrator] As Reona wanders the moonlit corridors, she encounters a spirit, a different one from her dreams - a ghostly girl shrouded in mist.

490.text: [Reona] (Stammering) I... I'm Reona. Who... who are you?

492.text: [Narrator] The spirit appears just as startled by the encounter, and they both run away from each other in fear.

494.text: [Narrator] As Reona catches her breath, she realizes that the spirit may hold the key to understanding the true power of the mysterious manuscript.

495.text: [Reona] I need to tell Yumi about this.

496.text: [Narrator] Reona quickly returns to her dorm room, her heart pounding in her chest.

498.text: [Reona] (Breathing heavily) I... I saw a ghost in the hallway. A different one from my dreams.

500.text: [Reona] Yeah, I'm positive. I think... I think she might be connected to the manuscript somehow.

501.text: [Yumi] (Sitting up) We need to find out more about her. Maybe she can help us understand what's going on.

502.text: [Reona] Yeah, you're right. Tomorrow, we'll start our investigation.

503.text: [Narrator] As Reona and Yumi exchange comforting words, their hands find each other's in the dark. Their fingers intertwine, and they drift into a peaceful slumber, their hearts beating in unison, ready to face the challenges of the unknown side by side.

504.text: [Narrator] On the lazy Sunday, Reona finds herself fully absorbed in the mysterious manuscript, captivated by its otherworldly aura as Yumi ventures off on a shopping spree.

505.text: [Reona] (muttering) This is just... incredible. It's like nothing I've ever read before.

506.text: [Narrator] Reona's fascination with the manuscript grows, her eyes darting across the pages as she delves deeper into the ancient knowledge. She becomes oblivious to the passage of time, the world outside her room fading away.

507.text: [Reona] (whispering) It's like the words are speaking directly to me, like they're alive...

508.text: [Narrator] As the sun begins its descent outside, Reona finds herself startled by the sudden ringing of her phone. She jumps, almost dropping the manuscript.

509.text: [Reona] Oh! Yumi must be calling to check in. (answers phone) Hey, Yumi! How's the shopping going?

510.text: [Yumi] (voice) Hey, Reona-chan! I found the cutest stuff! But listen, you won't believe what just happened... (voice fades out)

511.text: [Narrator] As Yumi excitedly recounts her encounter, a sudden, deafening blare of the fire alarm interrupts her, sending Reona's heart racing.

512.text: [Reona] (shouting) Yumi, I have to go! There's a fire alarm going off in the dorm! I'll call you back as soon as I can!

513.text: [Yumi] (voice) Oh my gosh, be careful, Reona-chan! Get out of there!

514.text: [Narrator] Reona quickly slams the manuscript shut and scrambles to her feet, her pulse pounding in her ears. The alarm's shrill cry fills the air, drowning out all other sounds.

515.text: [Reona] (panicking) Oh no, what do I do? What do I do?!

516.text: [Narrator] As Reona struggles to gather her thoughts and escape the building, she is plagued by a dreadful thought: Could the mysterious manuscript be the source of the danger that now surrounds her? The answer remains elusive, much like the shadowy figure that has been haunting her dreams.

517.text: [Narrator] Outside the dorm, a crowd of residents gather, nervously searching for the source of the alarm. Amidst the chaos, Reona spots Wictor approaching her, his eyes evasive and his voice trembling.

518.text: [Wictor] Reona, it was just a minor accident in the basement that triggered the alarm. Everything's under control now.

519.text: [Reona] Are you sure? You seem... nervous.

520.text: [Wictor] (sighs) Yeah, I'm sure. It's just... there's something I need to tell you, but not here. It's private.

521.text: [Reona] What's going on, Wictor? You can trust me.

522.text: [Wictor] Meet me in the basement later tonight. I'll explain everything then.

523.text: [Reona] (pauses) All right, I'll be there. But promise me everything's okay.

524.text: [Wictor] (nods) I promise. (He casts a furtive glance over his shoulder before disappearing into the throng.)

525.text: [Narrator] Reona is left with an air of mystery swirling around her, her mind brimming with curiosity and unanswered questions about the secrets that seem to surround her newfound friends. As the day turns to night, she finds herself walking towards the basement, each step filled with anticipation and a growing excitement for the clandestine meeting ahead.

526.text: [Narrator] In the dimly lit basement, Reona stands before Wictor, her voice firm as she demands the truth behind the fire alarm incident.

527.text: [Reona] I need to know, Wictor. What really happened down here?

528.text: [Wictor] (Sighs) I tried reciting a fire spell from the manuscript and...it actually worked. But when I tried other spells, nothing happened.

529.text: [Reona] So, you're saying this manuscript might actually have some kind of power?

530.text: [Wictor] It seems that way. But whatever it is, it's dangerous toying with forces we don't understand.

531.text: [Reona] We need to stop anyone else from finding out. We can't let this get out of hand.

532.text: [Wictor] Agreed. We'll call a secret meeting with everyone who's received a copy of the manuscript. We have to contain this situation.

534.text: [Narrator] As they discuss their plan, Reona's eyes are drawn to an enigmatic symbol etched on the basement floor, its cryptic nature piquing her curiosity.

535.text: [Reona] Hey, Wictor, have you seen this symbol before? It looks...familiar, somehow.

536.text: [Wictor] I can't say I have. But we should keep it in mind. It could be connected to the manuscript's power and the disappearances.

537.text: [Reona] You're right. There's so much we don't know yet, and I can't help but feel like we're getting closer to uncovering something... big.

538.text: [Narrator] With the symbol etched in their minds and the weight of their shared secret burdening their shoulders, Reona and Wictor prepare to confront the unknown, unaware of the twists and turns their journey will take.

539.text: [Narrator] Yumi returns, arms laden with bags from her shopping expedition, her eyes sparkling with excitement as she shares her spoils with Reona.

540.text: [Yumi] Look at all the manga and snacks I got! Oh, and I found this adorable plushie for you!

541.text: [Reona] That's so sweet of you, Yumi! I had a pretty intense day too. We need to talk about the fire alarm.

543.text: [Reona] Wictor told me he accidentally caused a fire in the basement using a spell from the manuscript. It's real, Yumi, magic is real. We have to be careful with it.

544.text: [Yumi] That's...terrifying. But it's also kind of exciting, don't you think?

545.text: [Reona] It's dangerous. We need to gather everyone who has a copy and figure out what to do next.

546.text: [Yumi] You're right. We'll call Chen and have a meeting with Wictor and Professor Diego tomorrow. In the meantime, let's relax and enjoy some of these snacks!

547.text: [Narrator] As the evening progresses, Reona and Yumi indulge in their shared passion for manga and sweets, momentarily leaving the troubles of the manuscript behind.

548.text: [Reona] I can't believe you found volume 3 of Uzumaki! Let's read it together.

549.text: [Yumi] That sounds perfect! Here, try this candy I found. I've never seen it before, but it looked interesting.

550.text: [Reona] Mmm, that's delicious! You always find the best treats.

551.text: [Narrator] The room fills with laughter and the rustling of pages, as the two friends immerse themselves in the world of Junji Ito.

552.text: [Yumi] I can't believe what just happened in the story! Did you see that coming?

553.text: [Reona] Not at all! But I think it's a great twist. I can't wait to see what he writes next.

554.text: [Yumi] Me too! We should definitely have a manga marathon soon.

555.text: [Reona] Absolutely! But for now, let's focus on the manuscript situation. Tomorrow, we'll gather everyone and figure out our next move.

556.text: [Narrator] With a plan in place, Reona and Yumi drift off to sleep, their dreams tinged with the anticipation of the crucial meeting that lies ahead.

557.text: [Narrator] At noon, in the dimly lit basement, Reona, Yumi, Chen, Wictor, and Diego gather around the ancient manuscript, a sense of camaraderie and determination filling the air.

558.text: [Reona] So, we all agree that we need to work together to uncover the secrets hidden in this manuscript, right?

559.text: [Yumi] Definitely! We'll need all the help we can get, especially since the dark aura seems to be growing stronger.

560.text: [Chen] And we should keep this a secret. We don't want to attract any unwanted attention or put anyone else in danger.

561.text: [Wictor] Agreed. I propose we form a secret society, dedicated to unraveling the mysteries within these pages.

562.text: [Diego] A wise decision. We must exercise caution and discretion in our endeavors.

563.text: [Reona] Then it's settled. What should we call our secret society?

564.text: [Yumi] How about... The Society of the Ancient and Unseen Script of Arcane and Glorious Esoterica?

565.text: [Chen] Sounds cool and mysterious. I like it!

566.text: [Wictor] The Society of the Ancient and Unseen Script of Arcane and Glorious Esoterica it is, then.

567.text: [Diego] To maintain discretion, I suggest we create a clandestine group chat for communication.

568.text: [Reona] Good idea, Professor. That way, we can share our findings and discuss our progress without anyone else knowing.

569.text: [Yumi] I'll set it up right now! It'll be our little secret.

570.text: [Narrator] As Yumi sets up the group chat, the newly formed Society of the Ancient and Unseen Script of Arcane and Glorious Esoterica takes a solemn vow to uncover the dark secrets hidden within the ancient pages. Little do they know, the path they embark upon will lead them down a treacherous road, filled with unexpected twists and turns, testing their bonds of friendship and trust.

571.text: [Reona] It feels so surreal that we're forming a secret society like this. Who would have thought something like this would happen at NYU?

572.text: [Yumi] I know! It's like we're in some sort of supernatural thriller!

573.text: [Chen] We should be careful though. If what happened to my brother is connected to all of this... there could be danger.

574.text: [Diego] I agree with Chen. Delving into occult matters can have unforeseen consequences.

575.text: [Wictor] Speaking of which... I've been practicing one of the spells from the manuscript.

577.text: [Wictor] Well... alright. But it's not much yet.

578.text: [Narrator] Wictor concentrates and flicks his wrist as a small flame ignites at his fingertips – no more powerful than a bic lighter.

579.text: [Reona] Wow! You can actually control fire? That's amazing!

580.text: [Chen] (Sarcastic) Impressive! How did you trigger the fire alarm yesterday with this?

581.text: [Wictor] I don't want to talk about it...

582.text: [Yumi] It's just like magic in those fantasy novels and games!

583.text: [Diego] Be cautious though, Wictor. Harnessing such power can be addictive and dangerous if left unchecked.

584.text: [Wictor] Thank you for your concern, Professor Diego. I promise to be responsible with my newfound abilities.

585.text: [Reona] Maybe we can all learn something from this manuscript that will help us protect ourselves from whatever is hidden within it?

586.text: [Yumi] That sounds like a plan! Let's work together and uncover the mysteries of this ancient manuscript!

587.text: [Chen] And maybe find out what happened to those who disappeared.

588.text: [Narrator] With determination in their eyes, the newfound secret society commits to delving deeper into the mysteries of the manuscript. Little do they know that they've embarked on a treacherous journey that will test their bonds and reveal shocking truths about themselves and their beloved university.

589.text: [Narrator] The group gathers around the ancient manuscript, their eyes fixed on a mysterious diagram that Yumi had discovered. A sense of foreboding fills the dimly lit basement as they contemplate the newly uncovered prophecy.

590.text: [Reona] This wasn't in the digitized copy... How is that even possible?

591.text: [Diego] It seems that some secrets were meant to be hidden from prying eyes. We must tread carefully, for we may be meddling with forces beyond our comprehension.

592.text: [Chen] I think this prophecy is talking about the return of some powerful being... But who or what could it be?

593.text: [Yumi] Maybe it's connected to the spirit Reona encountered? Or those vanished students?

594.text: [Wictor] Regardless of its origin, we must prepare ourselves for whatever challenges lie ahead. And if this prophecy is true, then time may not be on our side.

595.text: [Narrator] As Wictor speaks, Chen suddenly gasps and clutches his head. His eyes widen as he experiences a vision unlike any he has ever known before.

596.text: [Chen] I see... two ancient towers shrouded in darkness... A figure standing at its center... An overwhelming aura of power...

597.text: [Reona] Chen! What's happening to you? Are you okay?

598.text: [Chen, panting] I don't know... It was so vivid, like I was actually there...

599.text: [Diego] This vision may be a warning or a glimpse into what awaits us. We cannot ignore it.

600.text: [Yumi] If it's showing us what's coming, then we have to face it together!

601.text: [Narrator] United by their determination and newfound purpose, the group vows to confront whatever force lies at the heart of Chen's vision and unlock the secrets buried within the ancient manuscript. Little do they know, however, that their quest will lead them down a path filled with danger and unforeseen consequences, as well as the potential for love and heartache. As they steel themselves for the trials that lie ahead, an unseen presence watches them closely, its intentions unknown...

602.text: [Narrator] Later that night, Reona takes a moonlit stroll through the serene NYU campus, lost in thought about the mysterious revelations of the day.

603.text: [Reona] (whispers) I can't believe all this is happening... What does it all mean?

604.text: [Narrator] As she walks, Reona suddenly encounters the very spirit mentioned in the prophecy – a striking figure with an ethereal glow.

606.text: [Reona] Yes, but how is this possible?

607.text: [Spirit] It seems you possess a unique gift, young one. I am astonished that someone like you exists in this era.

608.text: [Reona] Who are you? And what do you know about this ancient manuscript and the prophecy?

609.text: [Spirit] My time is limited, but I can tell you that your fate is intertwined with the events unfolding around that cursed manuscript. The prophecy speaks of a great power returning to this world. You and your friends are key to stopping it.

610.text: [Reona] But why us? We're just ordinary students...

611.text: [Spirit] Nothing in life is merely coincidental. Each of you possesses something extraordinary within. Together, you may be able to prevent disaster from befalling this world once again.

612.text: [Reona] How do we stop it? What do we need to do?

613.text: [Spirit] Unfortunately, my connection to this realm grows weaker by the moment... Seek guidance from those who have come before... Trust your instincts... And remember...

614.text: [Narrator] Just as the spirit begins to divulge vital information, she vanishes into thin air, leaving Reona with more questions than answers.

615.text: [Reona] (frustrated) Wait! Don't go! There's so much more I need to know!

616.text: [Narrator] As she stands there beneath the moonlight, Reona realizes that her unique ability is to communicate with spirits, and she pledges to use this gift to unravel the tangled web of paranormal events plaguing their school. However, the spirit's final words echo ominously in her mind.

617.text: [Spirit] (echoing) Trust no one... The enemy hides in plain sight...

618.text: [Narrator] Over steaming cups of morning tea in their cozy dorm room, Reona confides in Yumi.

619.text: [Reona] Yumi, I need to tell you something.

621.text: [Reona] I think... I can communicate with spirits. Like, really communicate – not just see or hear them.

622.text: [Yumi] (gasps) Really? That's amazing! How did you discover this?

623.text: [Reona] Last night, when I encountered a spirit, we had a real conversation. She seemed to understand me and responded accordingly.

624.text: [Yumi] This is incredible news, Reona! It means we might be able to get some answers from the spirits themselves!

625.text: [Reona] Yeah, but it's also kind of scary. I don't know what this power means for me... or for us.

626.text: [Yumi] Don't worry, we'll figure it out together. Besides, I have some news of my own.

628.text: [Yumi] Well... (leans in conspiratorially) I've been investigating my own abilities too. And later tonight, I'll show you what I've discovered!

629.text: [Reona] Really? That sounds intriguing! Can't wait to see what you've found out.

630.text: [Yumi] All in good time, my friend. For now, let's enjoy our tea and savor this moment of peace before diving back into the world of mysteries and magic.

631.text: [Narrator] As they sip their tea and share a warm smile across the table, an unspoken bond strengthens between Reona and Yumi - two friends united by fate on a treacherous path toward the unknown. Little do they know that their journey together has only just begun...

632.text: [Narrator] Reona and Yumi sit side by side in their morning class, daydreaming of the incredible adventures they're about to embark on with their secret society.

633.text: [Reona] (whispers) Do you think Chen has any special abilities like Wictor?

634.text: [Yumi] (whispers back) I'm not sure. But it's definitely possible! What if he's telepathic or something?

635.text: [Reona] (giggles) That'd be so cool! What about Professor Diego? He already seems like he knows a lot about the paranormal.

636.text: [Yumi] Hmm, maybe he can summon spirits or control elements. You know, like a true sorcerer!

638.text: [Narrator] Their professor notices their whispered conversation and gives them a stern look before continuing the lecture.

639.text: [Narrator] Reona and Yumi exchange sheepish grins and refocus their attention on the lesson at hand. Later at lunchtime, they continue their earlier discussion with even more enthusiasm.

640.text: [Reona] I can't wait to find out what other abilities our friends might have!

641.text: [Yumi] Me too! Maybe we all have powers hidden within us, just waiting to be discovered.

642.text: [Reona] It makes me wonder...what other kind of abilities could I develop?

643.text: [Yumi] Well, you've already shown that you can communicate with spirits. Who knows what else you're capable of?

644.text: [Reona] That's true. I suppose we'll just have to wait and see what happens as we explore the mysteries of the manuscript.

645.text: [Narrator] Their eyes lock in a shared moment of excitement as they imagine the incredible journey ahead of them. As classes end for the day, Reona and Yumi can't help but feel that their lives have taken a turn towards the extraordinary – and they're ready to face whatever challenges come their way. Little do they know, the greatest test of their friendship and abilities is just around the corner.

646.text: [Narrator] After school, Reona and Yumi find a disheartened Chen sitting alone on a bench.

647.text: [Reona] Hey, Chen! What's wrong? You look upset.

648.text: [Chen] It's just... I can't seem to find any special powers like the rest of you. I've been trying all day, but nothing is happening.

649.text: [Yumi] Don't worry, Chen. Not everyone discovers their powers right away. Maybe it just needs more time.

650.text: [Reona] That's right! We're all in this together, and we'll help you figure it out.

651.text: [Chen] Thanks. It's just frustrating seeing everyone else with these amazing talents while I'm stuck being... ordinary.

652.text: [Yumi] Ordinary isn't a bad thing, Chen.

653.text: [Narrator] Hoping to lift his spirits further, Reona decides it's time to consult Professor Diego about his potential abilities.

654.text: [Reona] Speaking of powers, we haven't asked Professor Diego about his yet. Let's go find him and see what he has to say!

655.text: [Narrator] The trio makes their way to Diego's office and hesitantly knocks on the door. The professor greets them warmly but remains elusive when questioned about his own abilities.

656.text: [Diego] Ah, my curious students! My abilities are not as easy to define or explain as yours may be. Suffice it to say that I have not yet confirmed the full extent of my capabilities. There is much for me still left to explore and uncover within myself.

657.text: [Chen] So you're saying there might still be hope for me too?

658.text: [Diego] Absolutely! Sometimes our gifts reveal themselves in the most unexpected ways.

659.text: [Reona] Well, we'll keep searching for answers together then. As a team.

660.text: [Yumi] Yes! We're stronger when we work together, and we'll uncover all of our hidden talents in due time.

661.text: [Narrator] With renewed determination and a sense of camaraderie, Reona, Yumi, and Chen leave Diego's office, ready to face the unknown as they continue their quest to unlock the secrets of their supernatural abilities. But with each new revelation, danger seems to grow ever closer...

662.text: [Narrator] Under the veil of night, the dimly lit dorm room becomes the stage for Yumi's grand revelation.

663.text: [Yumi] Reona, I have something to show you. Last night, I wrote a poem that somehow…came true today.

664.text: [Reona] Really? That's incredible! Can I see it?

665.text: [Yumi] Of course. But promise me you won't freak out, okay?

666.text: [Reona] I promise. You know you can trust me, Yumi.

667.text: [Narrator] Yumi hands over her notebook with trembling hands, her eyes filled with both excitement and apprehension.

668.text: [Reona] (Reading aloud) Chen, a loser in the game of fate, // Dreams and hopes forever abate, // Destined to wander, lost and forlorn, // A life of nothing, a soul left to mourn.

669.text: [Yumi] Now think about what happened this afternoon...

670.text: [Reona] You're right... this is exactly what happened! This is amazing, Yumi! But also... really mean.

671.text: [Yumi] I know. That's why I didn't tell anyone until now. But if we're going to be part of this secret society together... we need to trust each other completely.

672.text: [Reona] Absolutely. And maybe our combined abilities can help us uncover even more hidden truths!

673.text: [Narrator] As they sit side by side on Yumi's bed, the girls discuss the vast potential of their newfound powers and how they might use them in their quest for knowledge and adventure.

674.text: [Yumi] Just imagine what we could accomplish together! We could alter fate itself!

675.text: [Reona] It's thrilling but also terrifying...We have to be careful not to misuse our powers or let them fall into the wrong hands.

676.text: [Yumi] Agreed. We must always remember our purpose: to unravel mysteries and protect each other from those who wish us harm.

677.text: [Narrator] Their conversation continues late into the night, their excitement and wonder intermingling with the shadows cast by flickering candlelight.

678.text: [Reona] I feel like we're on the verge of something incredible, Yumi. A journey that will change our lives forever.

679.text: [Yumi] And we'll face it together, Reona. No matter what challenges lie ahead, we'll overcome them as a team.

680.text: [Narrator] With their shared resolve, Reona and Yumi stand at the precipice of a daring adventure - one that will challenge them in ways they could never have imagined. And as darkness envelops their dorm room, an unseen force watches from the shadows... plotting its next move.

681.text: [Narrator] Over a sumptuous breakfast of Belgian waffles and fresh berries, Reona and Yumi share a knowing glance.

682.text: [Reona] I think we need to call a meeting with the others. We've discovered our abilities, but there's still so much we don't understand.

683.text: [Yumi] You're right. And who knows what could happen if we don't learn to control them properly? It could be dangerous for us and everyone around us.

684.text: [Narrator] The tension mounts as they send out a message in their clandestine group chat.

685.text: [Chen] Let's meet tonight at the usual spot. Together, we can find answers.

686.text: [Wictor] Count me in. We need to stick together and figure this out as a team.

687.text: [Diego] Very well. I shall attend as well. There may be some wisdom I can offer from my own experiences with the supernatural.
